content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the original and simplified passages

The passage:
Research aimed at understanding the dynamics of this new style of financial market is hampered by the fact that no operational real-world exchange is ever likely to allow experimental probing of that market while it is open and running live, forcing researchers to work primarily from time-series of past trading data.

DC: University student
ILT: Medium
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The complexity level of the passage is high. It includes technical terms and concepts related to financial markets and research methods that may be difficult for a university student to fully comprehend without prior knowledge. The sentence structure is also complex, which adds to the overall difficulty.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage
The section "no operational real-world exchange is ever likely to allow experimental probing of that market while it is open and running live" is complicated and could be simplified.
Simplify this section
Simplified section: "no real-world exchange will let researchers test that market while it is open."
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage

Revised passage: Research aimed at understanding the dynamics of this new style of financial market is hampered by the fact that no real-world exchange will let researchers test that market while it is open, forcing them to work primarily from time-series of past trading data.
Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original

Information Loss: 
1. The term "operational" was removed. 
   - Severity: Low - it doesn't change the meaning significantly.
   
2. The phrase "experimental probing" was changed to "test."
   - Severity: Medium - while "test" conveys a similar idea, "experimental probing" carries a more specific connotation relating to research methods that may not be fully captured.

3. The phrase "running live" was removed.
   - Severity: Low - it is implied in "while it is open," so the overall meaning remains clear.

Overall, the highest severity of information loss is medium. However, the core meaning of the original passage is still largely intact. Thus, the changes can be accepted since the information loss does not exceed the ILT.
What is the highest severity level identified? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
If needed, adjust the passage to maintain readabily and flow of text

Adjusted passage: Research aimed at understanding the dynamics of this new style of financial market faces challenges because no real-world exchange will let researchers test that market while it is open. This forces them to rely mostly on time-series data from past trading activities.
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The complexity level of the adjusted passage is now moderate. It uses simpler language and shorter sentences, making it more accessible to university students while still conveying the essential information. The overall readability has improved, reducing technical jargon and complex sentence structures.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
Provide the final version of the simplified passage

Final simplified passage: Research aimed at understanding the dynamics of this new style of financial market faces challenges because no real-world exchange will let researchers test that market while it is open. This forces them to rely mostly on time-series data from past trading activities.
